62284666.review:
Some things are best left in the past.

Returning to this game after so many years isn't the experience I was hoping.
I just cannot get over how dated the graphics are and how primitive everything seems.

It reminds me of trying to play GTA Vice City again - a game I spent countless hours on back in the day.
I just can't do it. It isn't fun anymore.

We have been spoiled by the luxury of the hardware we now enjoy, which gives game creators the power they wished they had years back.

I'd love to see these games remade - even in the Source2 engine, like Black Mesa - that would be fantastic.
Sadly, a 20 year old FPS SP game really doesn't cut it in todays world.

It's crazy, as back when these games were released, they were incredible - Half-Life was ground breaking.

What amazes me, is the difference 5 or 6 years made in the FPS genre - Half-Life 2 and other source2 based games are still pretty much playable and enjoyable.

When we look at modern FPS games, 20+ years on, the difference is even more astounding.

50308755.review:
I don't recommend. Why? At first, I had a mouse bug which didn't allow me to move my camera, you have to mark the checkbox "raw mouse input" in the Mouse settings tab to fix it. There were other bugs, but luckily nothing critical.

The idea of a new perspective and new weapons seemed pretty cool, but the game spends too much time having you solving easy but drawn-out puzzles and run around boring enclosed environments rather than fight against aggressive enemies. Eventually, it gets there, but almost at the end and unbalanced as hell. The new weapons are nice, but you barely get ammo for them and, once again, by the time you do the game is almost over. I sure enjoyed the custom training levels, those were pretty fun.

Let's talk about the story, how is it? A Half-Life expansion where you play as a HECU soldier? That sure sounds promising but it resulted to be generic and little creative. In resume, we the "bad guys", whose order is capture Freeman and kill the witnesses, end having to leave the base just as in the original. But now instead of HECU soldiers, we have other soldiers called "Black Ops" trying to kill us for being also considered witnesses? I checked out some other reviews and saw some people consider this to be as good as the original. In my opinion, It's not even near.

Another thing that annoyed me, the game is translated to Korean but not Spanish? One of the most spoken languages in the world. Really? I mean, Valve... you had over 15 years to do it. There are community translations, but it's not their job, it's yours.

If I had to pick between Blue Shift and this expansion, Blue Shift was more enjoyable. If you gonna play it, do yourself a favor and play this game after recently finishing the original Half-Life as I did. All the experience and familiarity from HL will help a lot since they re-used a lot of level ideas from it, lack of creativity I guess.

47340787.review:
These days when you think of Gearbox Software you probably think of either the unbelievably popular [i]Borderlands[/i] series or the believably unpopular [i]Aliens: Colonial Marines[/i]. In general you probably don’t think of anything good, but did you know that Gearbox’s first projects were [i]Half-Life[/i] expansions [i]Opposing Force[/i] and [i]Blue Shift[/i]? Probably not, since neither of them were very noteworthy or good. [i]Opposing Force[/i] was pretty clearly the one that all the time and money was pumped into. We play as Corporal Adrian Shephard of the HECU, an antagonistic U.S. military unit from the base game sent into Black Mesa to kill all the witnesses to the resonance cascade and subsequent alien invasion. [i]Opposing Force[/i] conveniently dodges making Shephard an actual baddie by having his helicopter crash on the way to Black Mesa. As such we wake up after being brought to safety by a group of scientists and have to fight our way out of the facility. Along the way we fight assorted enemies including the aliens from the base game, a couple of aliens not from the base game, and the black ops unit from the first game. We’re given an assortment of different weapons including a sniper rifle, machine gun, and a handheld version of the barnacle enemy complete with gross, long tongue!

You may even use some of these new weapons, but the easiest way to win is to stick with the basic pistol, which features a laser sight and is so absurdly powerful that there’s really no reason to use any of the cool alien guns you’re stocked up with over the game’s runtime. The most fun I had with [i]Opposing Force[/i] was swinging on the janky barnacle tongue, which was great when it didn’t bug out and kill me. The game has some very large areas compared to the base game, but unless you’re playing this in 1999 there’s nothing especially impressive going on here. [i]Opposing Force[/i]’s real issue is that it has new weapons and levels, but no new ideas. Nothing as original or exciting as what was on display in the original [i]Half-Life[/i] is present here, and taking place concurrently with the base game just means it’s treading water narratively as well as mechanically. The point is I went in with tempered expectations (I knew that this came out almost 20 years ago and that Gearbox made it), but was still disappointed. The temptation to play this expansions out of love for [i]Half-Life[/i] is a common one, and I cannot recommend strongly enough that you disregard it and just go outside instead.

Головокружительный успех HL положил начало трём дополнениям от сторонней студии, да и собственно самой GearBox. OF проливает свет на события оригинала уже со стороны служивых ребят.

Уже обучение в виде учебного лагеря выкатывает ворох новинок: лазание по верёвкам, расширенный арсенал, ПНВ, управление отрядом из нескольких классов бойцов. Казалось бы – перед нами идеальное дополнение. И так кажется примерно до середины игры. Но когда смелые дополнения сюжета привносят новую сторону конфликта и их трофейные стволы, баланс сложности (раса-Икс не иначе как комплектовалась исключительно различными моделями терминаторов) и вооружения летит ко всем чертям (нехватка боеприпасов против оружия с бесконечным боезапасом).

И вот выходит, что первая половина Opposing Force заслуживает высоких оценок и рекомендации, а вторая сводит её заслуги на нет. А как рекомендовать полуфабрикат я ума не приложу.

43212475.review:
Everyone says this one is the bee's tits but I don't see it.

Half-Life's level design is meticulous, at least for the first half. This one just feels lazy, the obvious solution sometimes isn't even the solution at all. I had a situation where I met a dead end with a vent I couldn't reach and a window leading to a fall that would easily kill me, there wasn't anything I could move or climb to get to the vent so after a few minutes I smashed the window out of frustration and jumped out to- what I thought would be my death only to find a small ledge beneath me that was impossible to see before. A few rooms down I come across a similar problem and bam. Indestructible window. What you're supposed to do is shove your hand up a barnacle's arse and swing across a chasm spiderman style. That is not a joke.

Health/ammo supplies are so low I thought the game was kidding. The new enemies are crack shots and don't feel like the running breathing shooting living AI that you'd find in Half-Life. And they are practically stuffed into levels at an absurd amount to the point that progressing is a brutal slog rife with save-scumming, a constant war of attrition where every hit you take feels like an instant failure, not even in an intense way. Just frustrating.

Story starts off ok, seeing the story from the perspective of the HECU was a logical next step for HL. The first few minutes capture the chaos of the original game pretty well, the Black Mesa scientists attempting to save the protagonist and his team not even knowing they were sent there to kill just about everything in Black Mesa was pretty cool. The story stops there though, you spend the rest of the game just running along until the G-man lets you know when you won it.

It feels weird to say there were too many weapons in a thing, but there are. 16 weapons. In the last leg of the game you must get a good three of them and not a whole lot of time to figure out what they do. By the end of it I spent more time fighting the weapon select than I did any actual aliens, and who needs two melee weapons?

Friendly AI is just as bad as it's always been, don't really want to follow you very much, get stuck a lot and killed more. The fact that they're a gimmick this time though made their flaws a lot more noticeable. I stopped bothering with them really quickly.

The final boss is laughably bad, I thought it was just blocking the door to the final boss until halfway through the fight. You just run around the same room over and over and shoot mounted guns at a thing until it dies. 

Unless you want the bragging rights of beating every Half-Life game (which I did) I wouldn't really bother.

42010482.review:
Посредственная модификация от Gearbox Software, где вы играете за одного спецназовца, который убивает всех по лучше самого Гордона Фримена (почему в первой части Half-Life не было таких мощных и умных спецназовцев, как тот, за которого нам предстоит играть?) У нашего героя тоже присутствует броня, по типу HEV костюма Гордона и защищает она аналогичным образом. А то, как главный герой использует новые оружия и бегает около радиационной зелёной жижы – даже Фримен нервно курит в сторонке со своим специализированным HEV костюмом. 

Мультиплеерная игра также оставляет желать лучшего, и дело даже не в том, что мало серверов и все с большим пингом, а в том, что сама механика игры некоторыми деталями сильно отличается от старого доброго Half-Life. К примеру, присутствует баг счётчика, в котором настенные аптечки и зарядники HEV костюма (?) дают сразу по 2 значения к броне или здоровью. Аналогичная беда со счётчиком оружий, а стрельба из MP5 это вообще нечто (в плохом смысле). 

Всё ли так плохо и стоит ли покупать игру? Игру определенно стоит купить по скидке, но не за ту стоимость, которая представлена сейчас в магазине. И то, если вам будет интересна сюжетная линий за пуленепробиваемого спецназовца. К явным плюсам можно отнести новое оружие, с которым просто интересно побегать. Помните, что это всего-лишь модификация которая представила GearBox и к реальной сюжетной линии Half-Life она не имеет ровным счётом ничего, по этому, сюжет игры сделан так, чтобы не противоречила и не вмешивалась в реальный сюжет (даже вместо существ из Xen, там по большому счёту будут существа Расы X).

40808049.review:
[b]Half-Life: Opposing Force[/b] is an expansion of the original [b]Half-Life[/b]. It allows you to witness the events of the first game through the eyes of Corporal Shephard, one of the marines who were sent to hunt down Gordon Freeman. It provides you with more weapons than the original game, including (but not only): a sniper rifle, an improved pistol, a grappling gun and a teleportation gun. The enemies you face are: black ops (including those pesky, superfast sniper girls) and the aliens (both new and old ones). [b]Opposing Force[/b] also introduces some new mechanics like: rope climbing and squad control. There is only a few times when you can use your squad members, but when you can, they provide assisstance in firefights, can cut through metal doors and heal you. Note: however, unlike Freeman, Shephard can't use the long jump module.

[b]Opposing Force[/b] had the potential to be a great expansion to a great game, but imo it's inferior to the original game in every aspect. It adds little to the original story, has confusing level design, boring and/or unintuitive puzzles and unbalanced enemies. [b]HF:OF[/b] relies heavily on surprise attacks and, it seems, that trial and error was the intended way to progress through this game. At times, there's too much platforming and not enough shooting. But when the shooting is there, it's against nearly impossible odds.

[b]HF:OF[/b] is nowhere near the smooth, gradual and intuitive experience the original game provided. That's why I can't recommend it. Unless you want to cheat through this game for the tiny bits of extra story that it provides OR really enjoy punishing hardcore shooters, just skip to [b]HF2[/b].

[b]My overall rating:[/b] [u]5/10.[/u]

39821998.review:
¡¡¡¡VALVE, PLEASE, SPANISH LANGUAGE IN GAME!!!!
El motivo que le dé un “No recomendado”, es simplemente porque el juego no incluye el lenguaje español, ni logros e cromos Steam.
Es una verdadera vergüenza por parte de Valve, que no incluya el castellano en el juego, con el tiempo que ha tenido y los millones de Euros que gana, para haber empleado algo, para arreglarlo.
Tras haberme dejado el dinero en comprar este juego, he tenido que recurrir a un parche pirata, para ponerlo en mi idioma. Un parche, que no ayuda mucho, ya que el sonido no está remasterizado, y hace, que en ocasiones, el audio de las conversaciones de los personajes, se acople con el sonido ambiental, y no se entienda un carajo de lo que hablan.
Os debería caer la cara de vergüenza, por tratar a la comunidad hispana, como clientes de segunda categoría.
Mi análisis sobre el juego, es bastante positiva (dejando a un lado el problema del idioma del juego). La historia y su evolución resulta bastante atractiva, comienzas viendo zonas de acción, a zonas con puzles a resolver, a lugares de terror.
Hay presente una nueva variedad de armas, de lo más atractiva, al igual que los enemigos a los que tienes que enfrentarte.
Los puzles y los enemigos, tienen un nivel aceptable, haciendo que te lleves alguna sorpresa, de ver algún “malo” haciendo algo fuera de lo habitual, y poniendo las cosas difíciles para eliminarlo.
La utilización de los compañeros soldados, esta poco evolucionada, ya que mueren muy deprisa al no poder recomendarles tácticas. Hay que tener cuidado que no mueran a veces, ya que uno de ellos, puede ser la clave, para que puedas avanzar en el juego. Como por ejemplo, que se encargue de abrirte una puerta.
Si juegas al videojuego, te sugiero que leas estos consejos:

1)	La pistola reglamentaria del personaje (la que tiene puntero laser), guarda su munición como oro en paño. Ya que es un arma letal contra extraterrestres muy resistentes o los soldados de negro. La munición de esta arma, escasea bastante.

2)	Guarda la munición del rifle francotirador, para los monstruos más resistentes o soldados negros, ya que un disparo a distancia en la cabeza o el ojo (según el enemigo), los elimina al instante. También hay muy poca munición de esta arma.

3)	Cuando tengas la pistola de portales, te percataras que apretando el botón derecho, esta te teletransporta a la dimensión extraterrestre, para que puedas coger ítems. Pues cuando encuentres batería de carga para la pistola de portales, teletransportate al mundo alienígena y cuando regreses a tu mundo, volverás al lugar donde están las baterías. En otras palabras, las baterías te indican siempre que es un lugar de regreso tras salir del mundo alienígena.
Por cierto, los alienígenas que te encuentras en el otro mundo, al usar la pistola de portales, no son peligrosos, así que no les ataques o te atacaran.
La pistola de portales, es un arma muy potente, para deshacerte de enemigos fuertes (a excepción de Jefes).

4)	El jefe final es fácil de vencer. Disparas con las dos pistolas láseres a sus ojos, y luego vas enfrente al agujero de su panza y te pones a disparar a su interior. Repite el proceso varias veces y lo eliminaras. No te olvides de esquivar sus ataques.

Tienes que saber, que el juego “Half-Life Opposing Force”, es una ampliación de la historia de Half Life 1 (Half Life, Half-Life Source o Black Mesa). No es necesario, tener en tu cuenta Steam el Half Life, para que puedas jugar al Half-Life Opposing Force.

Solo cómpralo, si te encuentras el Valve Complete Pack, por menos de 15€.

Si Valve se digna a poner el resto de idiomas europeos remasterizados (Español), logros y cromos Steam en el videojuego, prometo recomendar el videojuego.

38861713.review:
The game itself is fun if you ignore everything about the fact that it's Half-Life, and play it solely for the action.
However, even that has its drawbacks.
While, yes, it was published in 1999, there are glitches within the game that are so frustratingly obvious to the developers that it makes me question as to whether or not they actually bothered to give the game a run through to find and fix these glitches.
One of the many I've encountered is just a literal 'Getting stuck' glitch. You'll get on an elevator, activate it, and the elevator simply won't move because your body has frozen in place and is stopping it from being able to, y'know, BE AN ELEVATOR.
Another is where you'll die randomly when activating certain machinery, such as the Star-Wars; A New Hope garbage compactor rip off, where upon activating it, if you try to move, you will just...Die. Out of the blue. 

The lore as well, is an absolute insult to the Half-Life series. While Half-Life: Blueshift kept promise and stayed true to the series (But was disappointingly short), Opposing Force chooses to just throw in another batch of aliens into the mix. They are used as both the main 'Opposing force' to Opposing Force. The normal Xen aliens were practically thrown out the window, and are seldom used after the first few chapters (Minus headcrabs, Zombies and five Vortigaunts). 

You'd believe that these new enemies would include the Black Mesa personnel that are terrified of being butchered by highly trained Marines who have difficulty spelling, right?

Nope.

The game has ALL of the facility staff that you meet as friendly as possible, all practically running around naked, and none of the scientists even bothering to wear a Hazardous Environment Suit (Which must have been very well available due to how many bodies of dead HEV Scientists you find within Xen) and attempting to fight you and your men. 

What could you possibly replace the HECU with as the main human enemy within this horrid game?
Black Ops.
You read that right.
Black ops.

When originally, the Black Ops had only females whose relations with the HECU were unknown; Male Black Ops were added, practically being HECU that attack the HECU. Do they work as an Antagonist? Yes, they do, very well. However it simply doesn't make sense.

The HECU are advanced trained Marines that were sent into Black Mesa as a cleanup crew; The fact that they thought that  once a group as experienced as the HECU were unable to complete their job, that instead of just sending in another HECU Team to plant a nuke and extract, that they send in Black Ops to eliminate every NON-EXTRACTED HECU within Black Mesa, alongside all scientists, security officers and Aliens (Mind you, who ultimately fail at even successfully activating the bomb without the Gmans interference) is just retarded.

All in all;
It's a 'fun' action game with frustrating glitches and a horribly written story. Even the final boss fight is horrible.
My disappointment is immeasureable and my day is ruined.

Это ответвление халфы предназначенно для тех кому не хватало в первой части перестрелок. И оооооо читатель, перестрелок будет столько, что вам на всю жизнь хватит. Видимо решив, что 1-2 эпизода с суперскоростными телками в латексе с хэндкенонами в первой халфе, игрокам было мало(Спойлер: это самая гумозная часть халфы), поэтому разрабы решили что перестрелок с живыми людьми будет очень много.

И может быть это было бы круто, только стрелять тут крайне скучно, как никак игра 90ых годов, даже несмотря на огромное разнообразие оружия, которое не повторяет оригинал, а те что были в оригинале, были заменены другими моделями. Выстрелы не чувствуются, как и урон, ну это скорее придирки, игра старая что можно ожидать. И да повторюсь, пушек много - полезных из них единицы. Дигл, пулемет, снайперка - основной ваш набор, так как они убивают и иногда ваншотят. А ваншот этот самое главное, так как тут нет хедшотов, а только урон с растоянием в 3-5 метров действителен и ощутим для АБСОЛЮТНО ВСЕХ пушек в игре.

Игра вообще не прощает, даже на легком уровне сложности кабину вам выносят будь здоров, а аптечек в игре просто ПРЕСТУПНО МАЛО(На всю игру 5 станций хп), а те аптечки что есть, добавляют 15 хп. 15 БЛ ЯТЬ ХП. Чтобы вы понимали масштаб последствий последние 3 уровня я проходил буквально на 1-5  хп, это даже не шутка. А врагов вываливают просто пачками, уже после 2 первых уровней, их просто очень много для этой игры. Сначала, до совсем предела не доходит, а потом просто вываливают ВСЕХ:  и людей, которые просто нещадно аимят прямо в тебя не промахиваясь, и пришельцев дерьмодемонов, от которых ты буквально уровень назад убегал по канализации, так как убить их было крайне сложно, теперь игра тебе сует их как рядовых мобов.

Если смотреть на игру по сравнению с оригиналом, то вполне можно сказать что Opposing Force это то-же только в 2 раза больше. В 2 раза больше врагов на уровне и в 2 раза больше их разновидностей которых не было в оригинале, в 2 раза больше пушек и в 2 больше БОЛИ.

Сюжет отсутсвует, как класс. А логичность происходящего иногда просто отсутствует. ГГ будет бегать по огненым выхлопным трубам и проводам между зданий(я не шучу)

Как вы можете понять, мне не сильно понравилась эта игра. Однако, не рассказать о вещах которые мне понравились - нельзя.  
Во-первых, как я уже выше сказал, разнообразие чувствуется .
Во-вторых очень понравилась пушка, которая отправляет в любой момент игры героя в Зен, где в большинстве случаев вы можете собрать дополнительные патроны и с вероятностью в 0,5 процентов даже аптечку. Впрочем никто и не гарантирует, что переместившись в Зен вам не порвут лицо гостепреимные пришелцы. Так-что это своеобразная рулетка, о которой вы могли даже и не знать. Я сам узнал абсолютно случайно, в игре эта фича используется один раз. Вам же предоставляют попользоваться этим чаще. Ещё есть чисто сюжетный "ручной" барнакл, который работает как крюк-притягиватель, прикольно.

Сейчас играть в это категорически запрещаю, скучно до жути, а интересных моментов в игре насчитать можно по пальцам руки невезучего токаря-фрезировщика. Хотя с другой стороны, эта игра все еще веселее чем COD: WWII.

Оценка: 3 из 10 на 2017 год. В своё время, вполне потянула бы 7 из 10.

29732391.review:
SUMMARY STATEMENT:
This game is a half-assed attempt to make an alternative plot to half life. Every highlight of the game is just something you saw in the original. The value of this game is nostalgia, nothing more.

Every step of the way, you can both see and feel when valve employees said to gearbox developers "oh yeah and its gotta have this part here...  and honestly just model this part after this... you haven't put any of THIS in! Where is THIS?!?!"

E.g. they stole the bit where you have to jump across a chasm to reach a ladder, and they ripped off the canyon jumping sequence, and the pit worm (spoiler lol) is modeled after the 3 headed beast in blast pit... you get the idea.

You know how the Angry Video Game Nerd talks about video game publishing contractors (e.g. LJN)?

That's how i'd describe gearbox while putting out this "gem"

Every aspect of gameplay that feels even slightly good is offset completely by remembering how much better it was in the original Half-Life. Valve should NOT let their genius be ripped off by charlatans like gearbox.

There are some neat new weapons but for every cool weapon added you have 1 cooler weapon from half-life that didn't happen to make it in and 4 game segments that feel cheesy, like there was minimal effort put into it.

It is very easy to imagine this was coded, textured, etc. by about 15 people who spent about 300 man hours between them working on this while being completely focused on something else.

Surprisingly, however, the game has fewer glitches than half life. However, it retains the worst glitch of half-life, where you are in a small enclosed space, crouched, and the map changes (and you subsequently get stuck in the floor) meaning that you have to jump a while in the enclosed space, hoping that you happen to be in the air when changing between maps.

If you're not out to complete every half life game then this game is not worth it

do not buy

multiplayer is abandoned (Half life 1's multiplayer deathmatch isn't, though. Just saying.) so if you want to play that you'll need to arrange for a lan party or something

23931975.review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]

[list]
[*]New enemies, weapons and mechanics, the game works best when it shows the advantages you have by being a soldier.
[*]Shows you a new side of what was considered the enemy team in Half-Life.
[*]Cheap price, one of the most content full DLCs I've ever seen taking into account its $/min value.
[*]Includes the same multiplayer from Half-Life with an added Capture the Flag gamemode.
[*]There are some neat little additions in the animation department, there is a considerable amount of polishment and it shows. One of the alien guns actually have an animation that show the protagonist "petting" the creature. Very nice.
[*]During some moments in the game it will interwine with Gordon Freeman's adventure, and you'll be able to see dialogue from the original or even Gordon Freeman himself from a new PoV.
[*]There is no Surface Tension-like chapter in this one which is an absolute plus in anything related to Half-Life.
[*]The Training Camp chapter is hilarious and a joy to play.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[list]
[*]Many of the new weapons and enemies are re-hashes of Half-Life weapons and enemies.
[*]Some areas feel like a completely different game, pushing my suspension of disbelief that Gordon Freeman never saw the new alien race or the unbelievably differently designed areas of Black Mesa in the original Half-Life (is Black Mesa racist and only let the black guards work in one department?)
[*]The goddamn fucking green filter night vision is blinding!
[*]The game quickly abandons most of its "soldier" premise after the main team leaves and the rest of the gameplay is mostly a watered down version of Half-Life, with a few new uses of the soldier mechanics here and there.
[*]The store page advertises this game like we play as one of the soldiers ordered to murder Gordon Freeman, yet we're never really ordered to do so, as the game already starts close to the "Forget About Freeman" chapter of the original Half-Life. You barely even see Freeman through the game.
[*]Like in the original, some of the puzzles are downright impossible without a walkthrough.
[*]Like in the original, it's artificially extended, with some badly designed chapters that have no reason to exist in the middle of the actual interesting chapters.
[*]The multiplayer barely works most of the time, and is generally dominated by professionals.
[*]Disappointing cliffhanger-like ending, that will most likely never get anywhere.
[/list]

[h1]Overall[/h1]

It's still a fun game most of the time but significantly flawed and by the end of it, it's already a chore to play. I recommend only for diehard Half-Life fans since the ending has been confirmed to never get anywhere ever since Half-Life 2 released and it is really more of the artificially extended Half-Life bullshit. This game has VAC and it already includes the HD texture pack from Blue Shift.

[*] [b]Ужасный ИИ[/b]. Это вообще отдельная тема. Если тупёж врагов ещё как-то на руку тебе, то напарников которых прикрутили в этом дополнении....лучше бы не добавляли, они встревают тут ВЕЗДЕ! В оригинальной HL этого не чувствовалось потому что постоянно соло ходишь. Я минут 20 в сюжетном моменте пытался завести еб****о медика в коридор с улицы!!! Если вам дают этих эмбицилов на зачистку локации, можете о них забыть, они встрянут на первых 10 метрах.

[*] [b]Где-то я уже всё это видел...[/b] Понятное дело что сюжет проходит в том же месте, и в то же время, но принцип прохождения практически идентичный. Это скорее придирка, но всё-таки не понятно зачем играть в дубликат?

[*] [b]Новый саундтрэк?[/b] Не, не слышал.
[/list]

Возможно, уже не то время, и игра просто устарела после всего того что мы видим, но с другой стороны оригинальная HL1 заезжает вполне себе не плохо, следственно... дополнение так себе. I liked this very much in the beginning. It has a great story and concept and brings cool new weapons and abilities to the franchise. However, half-way through, it gets off ballence. Enemies are over-powered and numerous, often coming at you in ambushes. They also don't explain the new species of alien, or why Gordon Freeman and Barney Calhoun never saw any of them. There were many instances in which playing this game felt like a chore but by then you're too far gone to just give up now. There is a bug that prevents the final sequence from playing after you beat the final boss (which was a complete waste of time) so I had to go on Youtube to see the result of my seven hours' hard work. 

5/10 I love Half-Life but I just can't with this game. I'd rather replay Episode 1

This game doesn't stand on its own well.  It's severely dated and lacks any real story, and a lot of the choices for this game are poor.  (the alien gun that works as a grappling hook, but only in specific spots - it's otherwise useless, unforgiving difficulty in certain areas, uninspired design, etc.)

HAVING SAID ALL OF THAT - do yourself a favor and only play this game after recently finishing Half-Life 1.  All the experience and familiarity from HL will help this game a lot, and fills in what is otherwise a vacant story with the richness of the HL experience.  Otherwise, if you're like me (last played HL1 7+ years ago), this game is incredibly weak and leaves you wondering how there could be so many glowing reviews for such a poor game.  For me, my only previous play-through of Opposing Force was right after I finished HL1, and I loved it.  I can only assume it's because I've forgotten/lost so much of the HL1 experience that this was so uninteresting.

12239504.review:
At this point I've now logged more playtime in Opposing Force than in its significantly longer parent game, mostly to try and figure out my opinion on it. I think my total is two complete playthroughs and two abandoned halfway through.

My opinion from the start has been one of sharp dichotomy - the first half of Opposing Force is probably my favorite part of the entire Black Mesa Incident that makes up the original Half-Life and its spinoffs, while the second half is easily my least favorite. It took me a while, but I finally pinned down exactly where it all went wrong: right after the Pit Worm.

It starts showing warning signs earlier than that, in the alien "zoo" where sudden the game is a showcase of awkward alien "weapons" which mostly involve sticking your hand up some interdimensional bug's ass and squeezing its prostate until something happens, but after the Pit Worm the game basically dumps all sense of balance and is just a tedious slog of high-powered enemies, limited resources, and uncomfortable terrain until the final boss just sort of "happens" and the game ends.

One of the more unusual sources of difficult that this game has is actually too many weapons. Most people who are familiar with the pre-Halo standards of FPS design are fairly used to carrying around 10 weapons with no thought to where you're actually stashing them all, but Opposing Force isn't satisfied by a "mere" ten ways of violently resolving problems. It needs 17. This actually proves to be more disruptive than helpful, as not only is it hard to keep every single one of these weapons properly stocked with ammunition, but switching between them in the heat of combat actually becomes part of the challenge as you try to rapidly scroll through the weapons bar for a more situationally appropriate weapon while under fire.

Other nitpicks don't really stand out amidst the standards of the Half-Life games, like the breathtakingly stupid companion AI who will lose track of you if you move at a brisk pace more than ten feet away. They're at least slightly more useful here, with a medic who can actually fight, soldiers with something bigger than a rent-a-cop's pea shooter, and so on. Doesn't stop them from being mowed down in seconds by Black Ops ninjas, but it's something.

Ultimately though, the awful second half of the game overshadows any merits its early levels might have, so just give it a miss and play the other two instead.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein gut gemachter Ego-Shooter mit kleinen Rätseln, und schön designten Leveln.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man Spielt sich hauptsächlich durch das Black Mesa Komplex und bewältigt kleinere Aufträge und Rätsel. Die Gegner KI ist teilweise sehr gut gelungen (außer man ist schon an den Gegnern vorbei gerannt^^). Die Nebengeschichte zu Half-Life 1 ist nett gemacht, aber sicherlich keinen Meilenstein.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mehrspieler: 

Habe ich nicht getestet da ich keine Server gefunden habe.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grafik:

Ist leider nicht wie bei Half-Life 1 zu Half-Life Source verbessert worden. Aber trotzdem eine solide Grafik.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Hat auf jeden Fall nicht gestört wird zwar kein Meilenstein werden, hat aber alles schön zur Atmosphäre gebracht.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Hat sich gut mit Maus und Tastatur spielen lassen, Gamepad habe ich nicht probiert sollte aber denke ich mal auch kein Problem sein.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

- Durch Bug in Level 5 „Friendly Fire (Unter Feuer)“ nicht durchspielbar gewesen

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Eine nette Fortsetzung, aber durch die Bug leider nicht weiter spielbar. Von 13 Level, 4 Komplett spielbar ist das Geld nicht wert. FINGER WEG!!!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 3/10
Mehrspieler: 0/10
Grafik: 5/10
Musik: 5/10
Steuerung: 10/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 5/10
